_comment: THESIS ALLOCATION CONFIGURATION - All options with documentation

preference._help: How to calculate preference satisfaction costs
preference._allow_unranked_help: Allow students to be assigned to unranked topics (fallback)
preference._tier2_cost_help: Cost penalty for assigning to Tier 2 instead of Tier 1
preference._tier3_cost_help: Cost penalty for assigning to Tier 3 instead of Tier 1
preference._unranked_cost_help: Cost penalty for assigning to completely unranked topic
preference._top2_bias_help: If true: 1st choice=0, 2nd choice=1, 3rd+=100+. If false: ranked by position
preference._min_acceptable_preference_rank_help: MINIMUM satisfaction - prevent students from getting bad choices. Values: null (no limit), 10 (1st only), 11 (1st-2nd), 12 (1st-3rd), 13 (1st-4th), 14 (1st-5th). Tiers always acceptable.
preference._max_acceptable_preference_rank_help: MAXIMUM satisfaction - prevent students from getting good choices. Values: null (no limit), 10 (worst is 1st), 11 (worst is 2nd), 12 (worst is 3rd), 13 (worst is 4th), 14 (worst is 5th). Use to force lower preferences.
preference._excluded_preference_ranks_help: EXCLUDE specific ranks - e.g., [10] excludes 1st choice, [10, 11] excludes 1st and 2nd. No one can get these preferences. Example: [10] forces diversity by excluding everyone's 1st choice.

capacity._enable_topic_overflow_help: Allow topics to exceed capacity (with penalty)
capacity._enable_coach_overflow_help: Allow coaches to exceed capacity (with penalty)
capacity._dept_min_mode_help: soft = penalty for not meeting dept minimum, hard = must meet minimum
capacity._P_dept_shortfall_help: Penalty per student short of department minimum
capacity._P_topic_help: Penalty per student exceeding topic capacity
capacity._P_coach_help: Penalty per student exceeding coach capacity

solver._algorithm_help: ilp = Integer Linear Programming, flow = Min-Cost Max-Flow
solver._time_limit_sec_help: Time limit for solver in seconds (null = no limit)
solver._random_seed_help: Random seed for reproducible results (null = random each time)
solver._epsilon_suboptimal_help: Allow near-optimal solutions (e.g., 0.05 = within 5% of optimal)
